name: Admiral Markets
overview:
The Admiral Markets Group is a leading online Forex trading provider, as well as an emerging trading platform for precious metals, CFDs, stocks and fossil fuels. The broker currently counts 12,000 active clients and a total monthly trading volume of $35 billion. Since its foundation in 2001, the Admiral Markets Group has continually expanded its reach and today offers its services in 32 countries worldwide through its regulated trading companies.

Flexible Trading accounts

All financial instruments require only one trading account. Deposits can be made in most national currencies, which are subsequently converted to USD or EUR. Additionally, in case clients want to protect their capital from currency fluctuations, they can have multiple trading accounts in different currencies at the same time. Customers can transfer funds from one account to another through a convenient internal transfer straight from the Traders’ Room. Besides the traditional Standard Account, listed on the Instant Execution System, the Admiral Markets Group also offers a faster and more transparent ECN No Dealing Desk Account, called Admiral.Pro, and a CFD Account.

Licenses

European Union License: Admiral Markets AS, offering services to European clients as part of the Admiral Markets Group, is licensed and regulated by the Estonian Financial Supervision Authority in the European Union. Admiral Markets AS is entitled to perform investment and brokerage activities in financial markets, including foreign exchange, stocks, futures and CFDs. Consequently, Admiral Markets AS is authorized to provide cross border brokerage services in the 27 member countries of the European Union, and three European Economic Area (EEA) countries: Iceland, Norway and Liechtenstein. As a licensed organization Admiral Markets AS is publicly acknowledged as a company with unstained reputation, quality services, financial stability and security of investments.

Australian License: Admiral Markets PTY, offering services to Australian and Asian customers as part of the Admiral Markets Group, is authorized and regulated by the Australian Securities & Investments Commission (ASIC). ASIC is Australia’s corporate, markets and financial services regulator. It is an independent Commonwealth Government body which is set up and administered under the Australian Securities and Investments Commission Act (ASIC Act), under which it carries most of the Corporations Act. The ASIC licenses and monitors financial services and businesses to ensure they operate efficiently, honestly and fairly.

Forex Education and Analytics

The Admiral Markets Group offers numerous educational and training programs to empower its clients to make thoughtful and intelligent trading decisions. Regular, free seminars as well as online webinars in major languages like English, Russian, or German teach trading skills and awareness about risks and opportunities in the Forex market. A variety of books, brochures and articles on Forex trading in over a dozen languages give an overview over the topic for beginners, and offer experienced traders in-depth knowledge on special issues like technical analysis. To support clients in trading successfully, the Admiral Markets Group also provides a range of analytical tools: Traders find market relevant information in the daily Fundamental Analysis, Technical Analysis and Wave Analysis, as well as in the Forex Calendar.
